lines.text: Oh my, well this can't be right.
I hope it's not.
Well it's not. I mean, we've been staring at documents for too long. We have that white line fever.
I don't think so, Tesia. Truck drivers get that stuff.
Well, do you realise what this means?
Apparently your grandfather's been burying more dead bodies than he's been taking in.
There's permits here for three hundred and fifty, and he's deep-sixed over a thousand? Albert, where do you suppose he came up with all the extra bodies?
Swap meet? Sorry. Look, it's probably just some misunderstanding, that's all. It's a paper shuffle problem.
Paper shuffle problem? Albert, how do you just misplace six hundred and fifty corpses?
Well, just ask anyone who works at a baggage department of a major airline.
It's not the same thing.
Look, it's exactly the same thing.

This is like the baggage arrives okay, and the passengers are missing. What this says to anyone, and that includes the Meanies, is that at worst my granddad is a murderer, and at best, he's so senile he's burying people without their consent.
Well, you are overlooking one distinct possibility.
What?
He's laundering mob hit victims.
Great.
Ah! May I help you?
Oh my yes, indeed, I would hope so, yes. Um, my name is Miles Coats and - this is my day off, you see - and I was just doing a little price comparison.
Uh-huh.
Now, I'm not looking for anything fancy.
I understand. We here at the Papadapacropolis Funeral Home take the worry out of the unfortunate arrangements. We're here to serve you.
That's very nice. Do you have a crematorium?
Certainly!

Shop around, you'll not find more reasonable rates anywhere. And there are no hidden fees for urns or gravestones that you might find at at a competitively-priced mortuary. No reasonable offer will be refused. Is the deceased a relative?
Uh, no, she's my wife. Exactly how long does it take to completely ignite a human body?
Not long. Depends if you use starter fluid or not. What was your wife's name?
Uh, Sable Coats. I suppose all fluids... boil right out of the body?
Pardon?
Well, you know, saliva, blood... cyanide.
Not sure I take your meaning.
Well, that is to say autopsies are not, as practice, performed on ashes, are they?
Oh, no, not as such.
[Coats appears upset]
Are you able to continue, Mr Coats?
It's as if...
Part of her died with you, I know. Social security number.
She was in such pain, though. I'm just sure that she's...
Happier now, I'm sure. Visa or Mastercard?
Would cash be okay?
Certainly. Cause of death?
Um... suicide.
Would you like to make the arrangements now, Mr Coats?
Well, I'd like a little time to think it over.
Of course. here's our price list. I do hope you'll think of us when you make the decision.
Oh, I will, yes indeed, I will. Thank you so much, thank you.
